ul.li1: 1Do not rejoice, O Israel,
do not exult like the nations!
For you played the whore, departing from your God;
ul.li2: you loved a harlot’s wage
ul.li1: on all the threshing floors of grain.
ul.li2: 2Threshing floor and wine vat will not feed them,
ul.li1: and new wine will fail her.That is, Israel
ul.li2: 3They will not remain
ul.li1: But Ephraim will return to Egypt,
ul.li2: and in Assyria they will eat unclean food.
ul.li1: 4They will not pour drink offerings of wine to Yahweh,
ul.li2: and their sacrifices will not please him.
ul.li1: They are like mourners’ bread for them;
ul.li2: all those who eat it will be defiled.
ul.li1: For their bread will be for their hunger;Literally “for their soul”
ul.li2: it will not come to the house of Yahweh.
ul.li1: 5What will you do on the day of the appointed time,
ul.li2: and on the day of the festival of Yahweh?
ul.li1: 6For look! If they flee from the destruction,
ul.li2: Egypt will gather them;
MemphisHebrew “Noph” will bury them.
ul.li1: Nettles will possess
ul.li2: their precious things of silver;
ul.li3: thorns will be in their tents.
ul.li1: 7The days of punishment have come;
the days of retribution have come;
ul.li2: Israel knows!
ul.li1: The prophet is a fool,
ul.li2: the man of the spirit is acting like a madman.
ul.li1: Because of the greatness of your sin,
ul.li2: your hostility is great.
ul.li1: 8The prophet keeps watch over Ephraim for my God;
ul.li2: the snare of a fowler is on all his ways,
and hostility in the house of his God.
ul.li1: 9They deeply corrupted themselvesLiterally “They made deep, they corrupted themselves”
ul.li2: as in the days of Gibeah;
ul.li1: he will remember their sin,
ul.li2: he will punish their sins.
ul.li1: 10Like the grapes in the wilderness,
ul.li2: I found Israel.
ul.li1: Like early ripened fruit on the fig tree in the first season,Or “in the beginning”
ul.li2: I saw your ancestors.Or “fathers”
ul.li1: They themselves came to Baal Peor,
ul.li2: and they consecrated themselves to shame.
ul.li1: And they became detestable things,
ul.li2: like the thing they love.Literally “like loving things”
ul.li1: 11Ephraim’s glory is like a bird;
ul.li2: it will fly away—
ul.li3: no birth, no pregnancy, and no conception.
ul.li1: 12Even though they bring up their children,
ul.li2: I will bereave them before maturity.Or “until no one is left”
ul.li1: Woe to them indeed,
ul.li2: when I depart from them!
ul.li1: 13Ephraim, as I see it,
ul.li2: is like a palm in a meadow;
ul.li1: but Ephraim must bring out
ul.li2: his children to the slayer.
ul.li1: 14Give them, O Yahweh—
ul.li2: what will you give them?
ul.li1: Give them a miscarrying womb
ul.li2: and dry breasts.
ul.li1: 15Every evil of theirs began at Gilgal,
ul.li2: so I began to hate them there;
ul.li1: because of the evil of their deeds
ul.li2: I will drive them out from my house.
ul.li1: I will love them no more;
ul.li2: all their officials are rebels.
ul.li1: 16Ephraim is stricken,
ul.li2: their root is dried up,
ul.li1: Even if they give birth,
ul.li2: I will kill the cherished offspring of their womb.
ul.li1: 17My God will reject them
ul.li2: because they did not listen to him,
ul.li3: and they will be wanderers among the nations.
